subject: Fixed shader compilation error handling
commitMessage:
Fixed shader compilation error handling

Dali::Vector cannot use operator[0] after a Reserve (it asserts),
unlike std::vector.

Changed error handling to use Begin() instead, which returns a pointer
to the reserved memory without asserting.

Fixed exception handling, which uses the same string without the length
check.

Change-Id: I2e0131aec6cec209f27ef0ea7f903c718cbc4193
Signed-off-by: David Steele <david.steele@partner.samsung.com>

LLVM/Emscripten fixes

Signed-off-by: Lee Morgan <Lee.morgan@partner.samsung.com>

subject: Replaced shift and add sequence with single multiply in hash function
commitMessage:
Replaced shift and add sequence with single multiply in hash function

Archaic optimisation to think a sequence of instructions with
pipeline-stalling dependencies beats a single imul.
Compilers can still make the substitution with a shift and add if they
want to for a particular platform.

Change-Id: I313a5f98eae665f0fabd266fee09c078547be2ec
Signed-off-by: Andrew Cox <andrew.cox@partner.samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Not sure if this will work when we tap actors which are on different parts of the screen in succession.

I'd expect both to get a tap, but I think the way the code is now, only the first one will get a tap and the second one will be ignored.

I think you need to check the numberOfTaps field in Started to see whether it's worth doing the check!

subject: Added TextureRecycling feature.
commitMessage:
Added TextureRecycling feature.

This feature allows an application to recycle textures of
a given size/pixel format. This is useful for the use case
where many images are being drawn with the same dimensions
and are changing all the time; e.g. Gallery FastScroll.

Change-Id: Iad1d9b74bdb6e3f7907915923d4c85d0d0703b2f
Signed-off-by: David Steele <david.steele@partner.samsung.com>

subject: TextActor mesh geometry set on the base line.
commitMessage:
TextActor mesh geometry set on the base line.

Problem: the geometry is centered inside the text-actor size and glyphs don's follow the base line.
Solution: use the line height instead the glyph height to center it.

Signed-off-by: Victor Cebollada <v.cebollada@samsung.com>

Change-Id: I62484e0f6dc02f88fdc57d430fbe786a071d9e76

subject: Changed TextCulling to use off-centered bounding box
commitMessage:
Changed TextCulling to use off-centered bounding box

Text culling previously re-centered the mesh geometry.
Now it leaves the mesh geometry alone, and calculates an appropriate off-center
bounding box.
